FuncDef:
The echo-timeout count command sets a timeout threshold for CUSP connection heartbeat detection.
The undo echo-timeout count command restores the default configuration.
By default, the timeout threshold for CUSP connection heartbeat detection is 5.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a timeout threshold for heartbeat detection.
The value is an integer ranging from 4 to 10.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To specify the number of echo-request packet sending times used to determine whether the heartbeat of a CUSP channel is lost, run the echo-timeout command.If the heartbeat detection times out for countval consecutive times, the CUSP channel is disconnected.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
If the echo-timeout count command is run in the CUSP controller view, but not in the CUSP controller agent view, the command configuration takes effect on all CUSP connections.If the echo-timeout count command is run in the CUSP controller agent view, this configuration takes precedence over the global configuration.Do not run this command unless there are special requirements. Using the default value is recommended.
